results.title: Vicky
results.creator_credit: Elsa Bolam, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
One of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults about teenage alienation. An unhappy suburban teenager whose affluent parents don’t get along, Vicki turns to an older man and a life of crime. Scenes in Vicky’s home clearly show the lack of communication between her parents, and between them and the girl.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elsa Bolam, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Mark and Donny
results.creator_credit: Pedro Gandol, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Part of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults about teenage alienation. Having been caught in a stolen car, Mark and Donny are seen being interviewed by the arresting officer, who is trying to ascertain responsibility. Mark’s mother promises to get him a lawyer and helps him shift the blame onto Donny. The policeman, meanwhile, has probed Donny’s reluctance to return home and discovered that the boy’s father abuses him.

results.title: Robert
results.creator_credit: Cedric Smith, Signe Johansson, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Robert tells of the identity crisis of a fifteen-year-old whose father walked out years earlier. Already overwhelmed by problems at school, despair at the situation of the world, and his awkwardness with girls, Robert suddenly discovers that his mother has a serious boyfriend. One of a series of six short dramatic discussion starters for adolescents and adults on the subject of teenage alienation.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Part of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults on teenage alienation, Jenny is the story of a seemingly tough seventeen-year-old who is arrested for trafficking drugs. Jenny’s story emerges as she is interviewed by a skilful social worker. Her unemployed, alcoholic father has been sexually abusing her, and is now turning his attention to her weaker, younger sister as well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Selections from a child's garden of verses
results.creator_credit: Robert Louis Stevenson, Wil Berg and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Wildberg, who made this film, reads excerpts from Robert Louis Stevenson’s collection including “I have a little shadow” and “The Swing”, while a boy experiences or watches others experience the emotions and sensations of the poems

results.title: William Shakespeare's Hamlet [Branagh] [Captioned]
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, David Barron and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: A massive all star cast brings to life this full text version of William Shakespeare’s Hamlet. With his usual brash exuberance and strong visual style Kenneth Branagh works hard to keep the pace rolling, integrating the acting styles of experienced Shakespearian theatre actors such as Judi Dench, Richard Briers and Derek Jacobi with an international movie star cast, including Gerard Depardieu, Charleton Heston, Richard Attenborough and Julie Christie.

results.title: William Primrose: a violist's legacy
results.creator_credit: Mark D Collier, Brigham Young University and KBYU-TV
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary on Scottish born classical musician, William Primrose, who first studied the violin but very soon changed to the viola and became one of the world’s leading viola players, renowned as a soloist and chamber musician. In this documentary video, recorded at Brigham Young University, William Primrose reminisces about his past with host Dr David Dalton, accompanied by stills, archival footage and additional biographical material from William Primrose’s autobiography, “Walk on the North Side”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark D Collier, Brigham Young University and KBYU-TV

results.title: Selling out
results.brief_description: Dramatises a farmer’s last day at the ancestral home on Canada’s Prince Edward Island. Examines some of the economic and personal implications of the loss of the farmer’s home.

results.title: Selling Australia
results.creator_credit: Julia Redwood, Ed Punchard, Film Australia and Prospero Productions
results.brief_description: Selling Australia’ is a series of four documentaries exploring Australia’s cultural identity in response to the tourism industry. More deeply, the series explores the Australian cultural fabric and the dichotomies that exist within the country both culturally and politically. The Games” explores the role journalism and advertising had in encapsulating the Australian spirit in preparation for the Sydney 2000 Olympics and the response of the international media. “The Brand” looks at identities like Paul Hogan and cultural icons (the koala, Sydney Opera House and Uluru/Ayers Rock) and how they’re used to establish the brand “Australia”. In “Tourist town” the cultural and environmental impact of tourism is highlighted. Focusing on Cairns as a destination, we see how the tourist dollar has driven ecological change that sits at odds with the development of local culture and community. “The Red heart” focuses on the importance of the ‘outback in promoting the country and how Aboriginal culture has been used to sell Australia as a ‘spiritual’ destination. “Selling Australia” raises questions about the distance between the mythologised image and reality of a place and culture. Narrated by Sigrid Thornton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Redwood, Ed Punchard, Film Australia and Prospero Productions
